summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to the court chambers, submitting proposed redactions to the voir dire transcripts for the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It demonstrates the ongoing pre-trial procedural steps in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, submitting proposed redactions to voir dire transcripts to the court chambers in the US v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Submission of Proposed Voir Dire Redactions
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney submits proposed redactions to the transcripts of voir dire to the court chambers for the case US v. Maxwell.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated November 20, 2021, related to the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
An Assistant United States Attorney is submitting proposed redactions to the transcripts of voir dire (jury selection) to the court.
The attached files suggest the redaction proposals were prepared on November 16, 17, and 18, 2021.
The communication originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
This indicates ongoing pre-trial procedural activity and efforts to manage public disclosure of sensitive trial information.
